page.title: 10 ELIZABETHEN CAERSWS
page.content: CAERSWS IN THE DARK AGES FORMED PART OF THE WELSH PRINCEDOM OF ARWYSTLI WHICH BECAME VERY POWERFUL UNDER {PRINCE TRAHAIARN.}IN NORMAN TIMES AND THE MIDDLE AGES CAERSWS WAS A MARKET WHERE PRODUCE WAS BOUGHT AND SOLD.THE REGION WAS EXPLORED BY THE KNIGHTS OF ST.JOHN OF JERUSALEM ABOUT THE YEAR 1190.DURING TUDOR TIMES BLACK AND WHITE HALF TIMBERED HOUSES WERE CONSTUCTED.{MAESMAWR}AND{PETHEIRIN} WERE FINE EXAMPLES OF THESE HOUSES. DURING THE REIGN OF ELIZABETH, WILLIAM EARL OF PEMBROKE WAS A LANDOWNER IN CAERSWS WHILE WILLIAM HERBERT AND EDWARD HERBERT WERE OCCUPIERS.IN THE REIGN OF ELIZABETH AND JAMES 1 THE 'PARKES' AROUND CAERSWS WERE UTILISED TO KEEP THE ROYAL HORSES AND MARES.IT IS SAID THAT QUEEN ELIZABETH ONCE CAME TO CAERSWS.
